stanza.line: How like a winter hath my absence (a)been(/a)
From thee the pleasure of the fleeting (b)year(/b)
What freezings have I felt what dark days (a)seen(/a)
And yet this time removed was summer's (c)time(/c)
The teeming autumn big with rich (d)increase(/d)
Bearing the wanton burden of the (c)prime(/c)
Like widowed wombs after their lords' (d)decease(/d)
Yet this abundant issue seemed to (e)me(/e)
But hope of orphans and unfathered (f)fruit(/f)
For summer and his pleasures wait on (e)thee(/e)
And thou away the very birds are (f)mute(/f)
Or if they sing 'tis with so dull a (g)cheer(/g)
That leaves look pale dreading the winter's (g)near(/g)
